guide.introduction:
Last year on the MAKE YouTube channel, commenters started saying I looked like the singer from the English synth-pop duo La Roux. Here's how to get the Mondrian jacket look from the video for their song Bulletproof. You can also make your own "neo cameo" necklace with a laser cutter and these files on Thingiverse.

Find more photos in my La Roux costume Flickr set.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Last year on the MAKE YouTube channel, commenters started saying I looked like the singer from the English synth-pop duo La Roux. Here's how to get the Mondrian jacket look from the video for their song Bulletproof. You can also make your own "neo cameo" necklace with a laser cutter and these files on Thingiverse.

Find more photos in my La Roux costume Flickr set.

Relevant parts
  • White blazer or jacket
  • Fabric
  • Sewing thread
  • 1 8" acrylic
  • White sneakers
  • Black dress or tank top
  • Leggings
Tools
  • Cutting mat
  • Iron
  • Ironing board
  • Laser cutter
  • Needle and thread
  • Rotary cutter
  • Ruler
  • Scissors
  • Seam ripper
  • Sewing machine

lines.text: Find a plain white blazer or jacket to start. Try thrift stores or Etsy vintage.
lines.text_raw: Find a plain white blazer or jacket to start. Try thrift stores or Etsy vintage.

lines.text: Remove pockets (if it has any) from the jacket with a seam ripper.
lines.text_raw: Remove pockets (if it has any) from the jacket with a seam ripper.

lines.text: Create a pattern from one of the pockets by tracing it onto paper.
lines.text_raw: Create a pattern from one of the pockets by tracing it onto paper.

lines.text: Use a ruler to "square off" the corners.
lines.text_raw: Use a ruler to "square off" the corners.

lines.text: Cut pockets from a thick folded layer of each colored fabric.
lines.text_raw: Cut pockets from a thick folded layer of each colored fabric.

lines.text: Make sure the fold is at the top edge of the pocket.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the fold is at the top edge of the pocket.

lines.text: The yellow and green pockets are rectangular, so I squared up my pattern before cutting the square red and blue ones.
lines.text_raw: The yellow and green pockets are rectangular, so I squared up my pattern before cutting the square red and blue ones.

lines.text: Cut and iron a ton of 3/4" wide black binding. If I had to do it over, I'd probably order some black bias tape.
lines.text_raw: Cut and iron a ton of 3/4" wide black binding. If I had to do it over, I'd probably order some black bias tape.

lines.text: Pin binding around 3 raw sides of pockets, leaving the layered fold at the top.
lines.text_raw: Pin binding around 3 raw sides of pockets, leaving the layered fold at the top.

lines.text: Straighten the front flaps of the jacket by opening up the seam with a seam ripper.
lines.text_raw: Straighten the front flaps of the jacket by opening up the seam with a seam ripper.

lines.text: Cut off the excess fabric and use an iron to press in a new, straighter flap. Sew with white thread.
lines.text_raw: Cut off the excess fabric and use an iron to press in a new, straighter flap. Sew with white thread.

lines.text: Pin and sew binding to jacket around the front edges, inside of collar, and cuffs.
lines.text_raw: Pin and sew binding to jacket around the front edges, inside of collar, and cuffs.

lines.text: Because the bottom front corners of my jacket weren't square, I fudged it by extending the binding out past the edge.
lines.text_raw: Because the bottom front corners of my jacket weren't square, I fudged it by extending the binding out past the edge.

lines.text: Pin and sew on pockets!
lines.text_raw: Pin and sew on pockets!

lines.text: There's a bit of binding detailing over the shoulders and on the sides as well.
lines.text_raw: There's a bit of binding detailing over the shoulders and on the sides as well.

lines.text: Sew on five black buttons. Don't worry about buttonholes, you'll wear the jacket open!
lines.text_raw: Sew on five black buttons. Don't worry about buttonholes, you'll wear the jacket open!

lines.text: Grab the "neo cameo" necklace laser cutter files on Thingiverse: http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4436
lines.text_raw: Grab the "neo cameo" necklace laser cutter files on Thingiverse: http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4436

lines.text: Hang acrylic pieces from a long chain.
lines.text_raw: Hang acrylic pieces from a long chain.

lines.text: Pair with a long black tank top or short dress and some leggings.
lines.text_raw: Pair with a long black tank top or short dress and some leggings.

lines.text: Plain white or striped sneakers complete the look.
lines.text_raw: Plain white or striped sneakers complete the look.

lines.text: Don't forget the signature hair and Bowie eye makeup!
lines.text_raw: Don't forget the signature hair and Bowie eye makeup!

lines.text: Find more photos in my La Roux costume Flickr set.
lines.text_raw: Find more photos in my [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bekathwia/sets/72157625252669634/with/5123245497/|La Roux costume Flickr set].

guide.summary: How-to create a costume based on Elly Jackson, synth-pop princess from La Roux.
guide.title: La Roux Costume
